results.title: The Farm
results.brief_description: A photographic meditation on the family farm. This was 13 year old David’s first attempt to create anything using multimedia. It is a simple slideshow, but his presentation of his beloved family farm in all its moods reveals a connection to and feeling for place that is unmistakable.

results.title: The Fang
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The Fang is an animation that uses the animated contributions of past AIM students. Produced and directed by Al MacInnes with the song performed by his band Dan and Al, the Fang celebrates and displays the vast animation techniques and styles used by Al’s peers. The Fang himself is a character around town who wonders what the fang is and discovers that he is the fang, a very much sort after man.

results.title: The Fan
results.creator_credit: Edward Bianchi, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A suspenseful thriller starring Lauren Bacall as the glamorous Broadway actress, Sally Ross. Sally has many adoring fans but amusement turns into terror when she becomes the obsession of one young man who is prepared to go to any lengths to realise his ultimate fantasy. Cast also includes James Garner, Maureen Stapleton, Hector Elizondo and Michael Biehn as “the fan”. Based upon the novel by Bob Randall.

results.title: The Famine within
results.brief_description: The Famine within is a Canadian feature length documentary film about the contemporary obsession with body size and shape. Under the coercive powers of consumerism and the mass media, women have come to view their bodies as marketable objects and to judge them according to the unrealistic standards of the body ideal. Combining the direct testimony of many women who have suffered from body obsession, this film explores the kind of hunger that cannot be satisfied by food. Best Feature Documentary 1991 Genie Awards (Canada).

results.title: The Family: the boy who lived alone
results.brief_description: A young boy, Billy, runs away from home. As he walks, he observes others who appear lonesome. The film captures many of the thoughts Billy has about his family. After a wet, uncomfortable night in an abandoned house, Billy’s desire to become part of his family again increases and he decides to return home at daybreak.

results.title: The Family: life styles of the future (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Beryl Fox, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel, Document Associates and Hobel-Leiterman Productions
results.brief_description: Dr. Margaret Meade, considers the concept of the family. Whilst the nuclear family has predominated in industrial societies, Dr. Meade highlights current developments, including the communal family and the “three-way marriage”. She then progresses into a discussion on the factors that will influence the composition of the family of the future.

results.title: The Family: an approach to peace
results.brief_description: Shows that the only way to peace is in the understanding of other peoples, and contrasts the popular conception of foreign lands with life as it actually is around the globe. Through scenes of everyday family life everywhere, describes the similarity of the fears and aspirations of all people.

results.title: The Family that dwelt apart
results.creator_credit: Yvon Mallette, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cartoon animation of a story by E.B. White, first published in the New Yorker magazine in 1937. This is a tall Yankee tale about a family of seven fisherfolk who are living quite happily as the sole inhabitants of a small island in Barnetuck Bay until word somehow gets to the mainland that they are in distress. What happens when rescue attempts are launched makes an amusing story, illustrated with wit and verve by the film animation. Narrated by E.B. White. Also available on DVD [319319].
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yvon Mallette, Wolf Koenig, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Family prince
results.creator_credit: Jeannine Locke and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A candid look at the relevance and romance of the British monarchy from Prince Charles, Prince of Wales. Bridging the Prince’s frank, on-camera comments, the narrative script is combined with historical film footage to study the evolution of Crown and Commonwealth in modern times and to look at Charles’ younger years.

results.title: The Family of man. Part 3. Weddings (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Part three of the series, “The Family of Man” which sets out to compare family life in five different locations around the world. A comparison of weddings, the differences and similarities these rituals have in different societies are studied. There is also an investigation into some of the mysteries surrounding weddings in England - what the ring, veil, bouquet and wedding cake signify. By looking at weddings in other countries it is possible to make some shrewd guesses.
